name: Multi 16
keyboard: Full stroke 95 keys with 10 function keys and numeric keypad
coprocessor: Socket for an optional 8087 math coprocessor
ram: 128 KB (MP-1601S) or 256 KB (MP-1625) up to 576 KB
text: 80 x 25 or 80 x 20 for ASCII characters. 40 x 25 or 40 x 20 for Chineese characters
colors: 2 for monochrome versions (MP-1601S,1602S,1622), 8 for colour versions (MP-1605S,MP-1625)
description:
Multi16 was Japanese first 16-bit personal computer. This machine is known as first Shift-JIS code machine.

Shift-JIS code is Chineese character's code defined by Microsoft.  It met great success and became Japanese standard.

Multi-16 could be equipped with an optional hard disk unit. It was
only 10 MBytes and costed over $4,000!

Thanks to Nomura Hisayuki for this information

advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> JAPANESE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://web.kyoto-inet.or.jp/people/s-oga/">Soichiro Oga</a> for this picture !</p></blockquote>

peripherals: 6 expansion slots (5 available. 1 used for the FDD controler), RS232 and GPIB cards
